description:
Trichophyton verrucosum HKI 0517 is a species of dermatophytic fungus that belongs to the genus Trichophyton. Dermatophytes are a group of fungi that can infect and colonize the keratinized tissues of the human body, such as the skin, hair, and nails.

The strain Trichophyton verrucosum HKI 0517 is a clinical isolate that has been studied for its biological characteristics and potential applications. Trichophyton verrucosum is known to be the causative agent of a common fungal skin infection called "ringworm" or "tinea" in both humans and animals.

This particular strain, HKI 0517, may exhibit specific phenotypic and genotypic traits that differentiate it from other strains of the same species. Ongoing research may explore its pathogenicity, antifungal susceptibility, or other relevant properties that could contribute to our understanding of this medically important fungal pathogen.
